intro: Anticlea alpina, commonly known as the alpine antclea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Anticlea alpina typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
